feature: Update GHL Service for Evolution API
workflow_rationale: This is a multi-step migration task that introduces Evolution API integration patterns while replacing GREEN-API SDK usage. It involves sequential changes to imports, logging, methods, and module configuration, following established NestJS patterns already present in the codebase.

phases.name: Remove GREEN-API and Setup Evolution Imports
phases.description: Remove all GREEN-API SDK imports, remove BaseAdapter extension, add Evolution API client import, and replace GreenApiLogger with NestJS Logger

subtasks.description: Remove GREEN-API package imports and BaseAdapter extension from GhlService

verification.command: grep -r '@green-api/greenapi-integration' src/ghl/ghl.service.ts || echo 'No GREEN-API imports found'

subtasks.notes: Remove imports: BaseAdapter, GreenApiWebhook, WebhookType, IntegrationError, NotFoundError, Settings, StateInstanceWebhook, WaSettings, SendResponse, SendInteractiveButtonsReply, formatPhoneNumber, GreenApiLogger. Also remove 'extends BaseAdapter<...>' and super() call.

subtasks.description: Add Evolution API client import and Evolution webhook types
subtasks.notes: Import EvolutionApiClient from '../evolution/evolution-api.client' and EvolutionWebhook from './types/evolution-webhook.types'

subtasks.description: Replace GreenApiLogger with NestJS native Logger throughout service
subtasks.notes: Add 'private readonly logger = new Logger(GhlService.name)'. Replace all this.gaLogger with this.logger. Logger has .log(), .warn(), .error(), .debug() methods (not .info())

phases.name: Update Instance Creation Method
phases.description: Rename createGreenApiInstanceForUser to createEvolutionInstanceForUser with new signature and Evolution API integration

subtasks.description: Rename and refactor createGreenApiInstanceForUser to createEvolutionInstanceForUser with Evolution API
subtasks.notes: New signature: (ghlUserId, instanceName, evolutionApiUrl, evolutionApiKey, name?). Steps: 1) Create EvolutionApiClient(evolutionApiUrl, evolutionApiKey), 2) Call getConnectionState(instanceName) to verify, 3) Map state: open->authorized, 4) Call setWebhook() with events MESSAGES_UPSERT and CONNECTION_UPDATE, 5) Save to database with new schema, 6) Return instance
This method is no longer needed - EvolutionApiClient is instantiated directly where needed with (evolutionApiUrl, evolutionApiKey)

phases.name: Update Webhook Handling Methods
phases.description: Rename handleGreenApiWebhook to handleEvolutionWebhook and update for Evolution API format, update handleStateInstanceWebhook

subtasks.description: Rename and refactor handleGreenApiWebhook to handleEvolutionWebhook
subtasks.notes: New signature: handleEvolutionWebhook(webhook: EvolutionWebhook). Parse {event, instance, data}. Look up by instanceName. For messages.upsert: use transformer.toPlatformMessage(), For connection.update: call updated handleConnectionUpdate()

subtasks.description: Update handleStateInstanceWebhook to handleConnectionUpdate for Evolution events
subtasks.notes: Rename to handleConnectionUpdate. Accept Evolution format. Use new InstanceState enum values: open, close, connecting

phases.name: Update Message Sending Methods
phases.description: Update handlePlatformWebhook and handleWorkflowAction to use Evolution API client instead of GREEN-API

subtasks.description: Update handlePlatformWebhook to use EvolutionApiClient for sending messages
subtasks.notes: Create EvolutionApiClient(instance.evolutionApiUrl, instance.evolutionApiKey). Use transformer.toEvolutionMessage(ghlWebhook). Check result type: if has 'text' property use sendText(), if has 'mediatype' use sendMedia(). Instance lookup changes to use instanceName.

subtasks.description: Update handleWorkflowAction to use EvolutionApiClient for all action types
subtasks.notes: Replace greenApiClient with EvolutionApiClient. For 'message': use sendText(). For 'file': use sendMedia(). For 'interactive-buttons' and 'reply-buttons': Evolution API may not support - convert to text message with button options listed.

phases.name: Update GHL Module Configuration
phases.description: Import EvolutionModule in GhlModule to make EvolutionApiClient available for dependency injection

subtasks.notes: Add import { EvolutionModule } from '../evolution/evolution.module'. Add EvolutionModule to imports array in @Module decorator.

phases.name: Integration Verification
phases.description: Verify all changes work together and TypeScript compiles without errors

subtasks.description: Verify TypeScript compilation passes with no errors
subtasks.notes: Run npm run build and verify no TypeScript errors. Fix any type issues.

subtasks.description: Verify complete removal of all GREEN-API references

verification.command: grep -rE 'green-api|GreenApi|greenApi|gaLogger' src/ghl/ghl.service.ts || echo 'All GREEN-API references removed'

subtasks.notes: Final cleanup verification - no GREEN-API, GreenApi, greenApi, or gaLogger references should remain

parallel_groups.reason: All depend only on phase-1, modify different methods/files

parallelism.speedup_estimate: Sequential recommended - single file with interconnected changes and shared dependencies

acceptance_criteria: No GREEN-API imports remain in ghl.service.ts
No GreenApiLogger or gaLogger references remain
All methods use EvolutionApiClient instead of GREEN-API client
Instance creation uses Evolution API getConnectionState and setWebhook
Webhook handling parses Evolution format correctly

verification_steps.name: GREEN-API Removal Check
verification_steps.command: grep -r '@green-api/greenapi-integration' src/ghl/ || echo 'PASS: No GREEN-API imports'

verification_steps.name: Evolution Client Usage Check
verification_steps.command: grep 'EvolutionApiClient' src/ghl/ghl.service.ts && echo 'PASS: Using Evolution client'

verification_strategy.reasoning: Medium risk refactor of core integration service. Verification focuses on complete removal of GREEN-API SDK and successful Evolution API client integration. No external API testing required - focus on code structure verification.
